meanings.definition: Not loud, bright, noticeable, or obvious in any way
meanings.sent1: The painting had a suttle color palette, with soft blues and gentle greens.
meanings.sent2: She preferred suttle makeup, opting for a natural look with light shades.
meanings.sent3: The detective wore a suttle disguise, blending in perfectly at the costume party.
meanings.sent4: His humor was suttle, like a whisper that made everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance was suttle, a delicate hint of flowers in the air.

meanings.definition: To make something less noticeable or obvious
meanings.sent1: She tried to suttle down the bright colors by adding a layer of white paint.
meanings.sent2: The designer decided to suttle the pattern by using a lighter fabric.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to suttle the noise of the party by playing soft music.
meanings.sent4: The artist used shadows to suttle the harsh lines of the drawing.
meanings.sent5: The chef used herbs to suttle the strong taste of the dish.

meanings.definition: To make something less strong or extreme
meanings.sent1: The doctor advised him to suttle the dosage of the medication to avoid side effects.
meanings.sent2: She decided to suttle the spiciness of the curry by adding coconut milk.
meanings.sent3: The coach suggested suttleing the intensity of the training to prevent injuries.
meanings.sent4: He tried to suttle the argument by calmly explaining his point of view.
meanings.sent5: The teacher suttleed the difficulty of the test by providing extra study materials.
